reviewText:
Early Access Review

**********************************************************************************************
UPDATE ONLY ABOUT 9 HOURS AFTER MY REVIEW WENT UP ON STEAM HERE:

I gotta say, this is how you handle criticism on your early access game!  These developers didn't take the only review so far ...my original review found below, being negative and basically saying this game is too early in its development status to charge $30 USD.

..These developers LISTENED to me... and to the other people in the community forums saying that this game is asking too much money for it's early state of development!

I will leave my original review unchanged below just so that viewers can see my original first review based on this games original $29.99 USD price tag at it's early access launch.

But because of the developers listening to this only review so far... and the other posters on the forums here... I must say that I LOVE this kind of professional response so quick from them.

..They didn't blame me for having an insufficient computer or blame the way I played their game.

..They didn't make excuses of any kind.

...They simply listened and dropped their price in half, and are offing refunds to anyone who purchased this game at it's original price tag for early access of $29.99 USD.

....And for that reason, and because I do believe this game certainly shows a ton of potential... and also because I can see most users getting $15 USD worth of fun out of this game in its current state, then I am CHANGING my review from a negative to a positive review.  Obviously, changing the price doesn't fix the problems, bugs, or make the game itself any different.  But what it does do is shows me that this development team listens to feedback which is HUGE!  I do believe they will fix bugs and continue to give this game updates and make it better and better as well.

It is now worth it's asking price.  And it has developers who listen and react quickly to criticism rather then act like cocky jackazzes who make every excuse in the book (we've all seen too many developers like that, right?)

Thank you developers for listening.  And reactiving professionally.  You have my support now, and I will in turn play your game more, upload more videos, and share why MyDream" is worth it's new asking price!

....If only more developers were like this!  Other developers can and should learn from this!  :-)

******************************************************************************************************

---- EVERYTHING BELOW SHOULD BE TAKEN WITH THE UNDERSTANDING THAT THIS WAS BASED ON THIS GAMES INITIAL ASKING PRICE OF $29.99 USD AND BEFORE THEY SHOWED THEY CARE ABOUT LISTENING TO THEIR CUSTOMERS AND REACTING QUICKLY AND PROFESSIONALLY.   THIS ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW WILL REMAIN UN-ALTERED
date: HOWEVER  WHAT I STATE ABOVE SHOULD BE CONSIDERED AS MOST RECENT REACTIONS FROM MYSELF ON THE VALUE OF THIS GAME
recommended:
THANK YOU. ---
-----------------------   ------------------------------   -------------------------

Watch My Video Review At This Early Access Launch Here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=92lNiAhKn28

Okay

reviewText:
Early Access Review

========================================

Vince Rowe ReviewsSaving the Industry one Game at a Time!

[YouTube Link]   [Curation Link]

========================================


THIS REVIEW WILL BE UPDATED DURING THE GAME'S DEVELOPMENT
Verdict - 5.8 - Decent - Extremely Early Access
Graphics - 6/10 - Decent
Models - 5/10 - Average
Environment - 6/10 - Decent
Sound - 3/10 - Poor
Music - 7/10 - Good
Building - 8/10 - Great



Introduction:
MyDream is another Sandbox survival game with an enthasis on construction, it's been done before but none of them have really perfected it yet. There's a great deal of room for improvement but equally there's a great deal of room for potential as well. The Developers seem to have their heads screwed on and an idea of how they want this game to play out. At the time of this review it is in very Early Access with very limited content so I can only recommend this game to you if:

You are interested in the game, want to be part of the development process and want to support the Developers.
Or
If you really like Construction games and want to build structures, buildings and landscapes (As this is the only fully implemented feature at this time).




Pros:
+ Good graphics
+ Good environments (Very primitive Procedural Generation at the moment)
+ Great terrain mechanics (It's curved and not blocky like most other Sandbox games)
+ Great building mechanics
+ Large amount of building objects/decorations
+ Decent background music
+ Amazing concepts/ideas for the future of the game
+ Reliable, helpful and responsive Developers



Cons:
- Bad audio
- Extremely low FOV (Subject to change soon)
- - - Extremely Early Access




Additional Information:
There's not a lot to do in this game at this moment in time, you can pretty much just build which is what the majority of the playerbase has been doing, if building is your thing then you'll have fun playing this. Unfortunately, due to it's very Early state I can only recommend this game if you like building or if you're willing to wait for future updates.

The graphics are fine, they could be better but they could be a lot worse - especially for an Early Access game so I'll let it slide on this.

Look at this marvellous house I built!
http://steamcommunity.com/id/Khrayfish/screenshot/538519528516368715

The original price was $30 but the developers listened to the feedback and decided to reduce the price of the game! It's good to see developers that care ‚ò∫

Unfortunately that's about all I can say about this game at this moment in time, it's a very niche game so only buy it if you're absolutely sure you want to or if you like the direction and you want to support the developers.

Link to my Twitter Page.
{LINK REMOVED} Link to my Blog.
Link to my Curations.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I backed this game on kickstarter a year ago. I recieved the alpha, and even then I was impressed! The Gameplay is Surprisingly Refreshing For The Sandbox genre With A Calming And Mello Tone. If You Play Sandbox games For Building, Purchase This Game Now. If You Play For The Adventure I would Hold off For Their future Updates, The Developers Plan To Add Many Adventurous Features, But So Far Its All About The Building.  But What I Found Even More Impressive Than The Game Were The Developers Attitudes Towards The Consumers, I Would Ask About Glitches And A Few Hours Later they Would Respond, I would ask about computer preformance, they would respond, And Probably The best example of their Interaction with the consumers is when this game first came to steam with the steep price of 30 US Dollars. Thats Steep. I Wouldnt Pay 30 Dollars To Any Game Alpha Or Finished Without It Being fonamonal! And Mydream Just Isnt At The 30 Dollar Mark yet, But A Consumer Told Them This What Did They Do? They Refunded Half Of every Purchase of Their Game And Dropped The Price By half For The Rest of The Consumers! Amazing! This Game Is Now Worth Everypenny I Can Not Wait To See Where it Will Go, And How Close The Developers Will be With Their Players. if You Like Sandbox Games Stop Reading, And Purchase This Now.


I Would Also Like To Say You Should Check Their Kickstarter Page To See Future Plans If You Are Still Unsure About This Game. Rock Monsters, Pets, Wings, So Much More Is Coming To This Amazing Game!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

MyDream is a building game like Lego Worlds or Minecraft. Right now its in Early Access Mode but you have a lot of content already.  You can play alone, offline or Online with friends and other players.

For my first time, I started to play it offline. You dont need to create an Account to play in that way, for Online Mode you need an Account.

Game starts like other Building Games, you create a randome world, where you can build things you like. there are Walls, Windows, Doors, Plants, Stones, Signs and many more. I started to build a house and a temple, controlls are easy but a bit tricky on some parts but after a while you get used to it.

There are a few bugs and glitches but thats normal for EA, I didnt had bugs like freeze or crashes, but sometimes when adding a window on my house it rotated and I was not able to put it in the direction I liked or when you build a lot it starts to use too much Ram. Also a few items attacks you and you can die, so you have to be a bit carefull ^^

Graphic loocks nice and soundtrack is greate.

If you love Building Games and you don`t have problems with Early Access Games (what means the game is not finished yet and can have a lot of bugs and glitches) buy it, you will enjoy it, else you can give it back if you don`t play more then 2 hours. So there is no risk at all.

This Game has a lot of potential and will hopefully be much better in the future, especially with the multiplayer.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am in desperate need of a tutorial, but essentially I am able to do anything I want. I feel like there's tons of hidden potential in creating mini-games, maps, scenarios, or just overall fun interactive levels. It looks good on Unity (as always), and def a new take on the Voxel side of gaming. I don't know if I am creative enough to do anything crazy, but I would love to see other minds creating things.

It displeases me that the invert mouse setting does not work/apply. I didn't have any frame drops. I am unsure of what the 2nd tool was (laser gun?) and walking speeds is tremendously slow.

Couldn't find water blocks when trying to create a world... could be me.

The main menu was fine, but the online menu after logging in was quite convaluted and could be reduced to please the eye more, or at least arranged in such a way that would not be overwhelming.

I want to see a multiplayer community develop for this game. A lot of fun can come from this!

Reminds me of a voxel/unity version of Blockland (minus the explosive physics).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have just started getting involved with this game and getting a feel for things, and honestly I can say I am quite impressed so far. This game mentions it is in Alpha currently from the store page, but from an hour of exploring the world and its tools there is a lot already available in terms of creating tools and options. So this game is definitely not lacking in its content and what you can do with the worlds you want to create. There's a lot to toy around with, especially with materials and crafting items.

There are some kinks still, as is to be expected from an Alpha. As I have justed started exploring, I feel as though there is a lack of community tools. However, there is already a large community building their own worlds that you can explore, which is quite interesting and really adds appeal to the game. With so much to explore, there's always new content to go back to, so this game holds more replay value than I could say for most games. With the price point this game is currently at, that is a lot of content for the price I would say.

I am thrilled to join the community in this game, and can't wait to see where the game goes from here.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

MyDream is one of the games that will take you on awesome adventure!

Creating your first world is where you have to start, then the fun begins!

-You can create your own world and then create quests,buildings,dungeons in it then play them with friends/other players
-You can also explore the world and complete quests ,  alone or with other players/friends.
-You can join other worlds and explore what other players done and play the quests they've made , build together and alot more.
-You have alot of building items as choise in your inventory , use your imagination to build !

Controls of the game are pretty smooth, but it takes a while to get used to the use of the tools

-You can Walk,run or fly around the worlds interacting with creatures.

The tool that i liked a lot is the Terraforming gun which allows you to change the terrain


I see alot potential in this game in future

If you are the type of gamer you love to create and have no problem with the current Early Access i suggest you buying the game. If you have any problems you can post in the community discussions and the staff/members can try to give you a hand on your Issue


P.S Updates comming soon

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Last update: April 12th, 2016 @ 2:34 a.m
Reminder: this is an early access review, it does not represent the final version and has been done as of April 12th, 2016.

These are my very own impressions and opinion about the game, and for sure, i can be wrong (and if so feel free to comment and i'll rewrite it). Just want to be constructive and help both users and developers with the review.
Gameplay smooth, controls are fine, and easy to understand.
Tutorial... been unable to complete it, for now, tried it like 10 times and always got some rocks.. or an enire mountain in the middle, wich makes impossible to advance. The futher i've got at the tutorial is where you have to climb, and got a rock right above me, making it impossible.

Visuals: 8/10 Seriously, for being an indie game, the textures and models are gorgeous.
Screenshots of the game (minimum settings)

Note about visuals: player model needs resize (or camera/collider check), from the camera POV the gloves and foot go under the terrain while looking down.

Performance: Well, this could be a bit of a negative point, regarding the suggested specs of the steam store page.

Did many tests as of now about performance, and for very prop-crowded scenarios even with system specs like mine, got low fps (20 or below), else depending on the scenario/map, fps can be from 40 to 150(uncapped) at medium settings.

Please check my system specs at my Profile page
Will be updating the review as i'm still trying the game and i'll keep playing and trying new things as they come to my mind.
The game looks promising, thumbs up, devs (read below, please)!

--------------------------------------------------------

Suggestions/bugs report:
While in a world, when i do /help, i can't scroll up to see the entire list, remember that the people can always 'guess' some commands, but not them all.

The in-game (in a world) help button of the menu is not working.

High-populated maps (regarding props, not players) are lacking optimisation, even with a high-end system are hard to manage. It could be also because of shaders or lightning but from what i saw ingame i would bet for prop's fult.

Tutorial Needs to be fixed, my suggestion for this would be that instead of 'randomly' generate the world for the tutorial, to set it on a flat map, at least for now as a quick fix.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

MyDream is a 3D first-person god sim, where you start building from a scratch on a generated world and may create your own vision, with a mouse and keyboard, on how a fantasy world should look like, and what one would be able to do on it.

For the game you will need to create separate account on MyDream servers. Once you're done with that you will log into the main menu. From there I had a hard time finding tutorial- button, which I then found under the Question mark- menu. (Hint for the other new players!) I have to remind you that the game is still in Beta, so I didn't expect everything to work - just like the tutorial, which I wasn't able to finish since my way was blocked by rocky structure. Also I fell through the ground couple of times but teleporting back to the starting point fixed that.

Once you start creating your own world you get to decide your own world's name and layout. The given map is big enough for exploring and you are able to create your own quests for future world visitors. Think of this game as a Minecraft with graphical boost, plus the ability to create your own quests for others and yourself.

Building structures (I- button opens the inventory) was hard but rewarding - I built some mazes which I then accidentally destroyed. I realised that the more you build the longer you will have to wait for the world to get loaded.

MyDream has hours upon hours of structure building, terrain editing and quest creating - each world is an adventure of its own. However, I missed more sound effects and music inside the actual world, which would be awesome to be edited by the creator himself.

Judgment
If you get bored you can always play piano sounds from 9 different piano tones.

Worth the price for possible next-gen Minecraft. But not for the updates!
PLUSSES AND MINUSES:

- unfinishable tutorial
- bugs and lags
- no music inside worlds
- hardly any players online

+ many worlds
+ create your own buildings, terrains and quests
+ hours of planning and implementing
+ greater graphics than just cubes compared to Minecraft

GRAPHICS6SOUNDS EFFECTS3CONTROLS6MATERIAL RICHNESS8
OVERALL RATE: 6
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My PC:

OS: Windows 10 64-bit
CPU: I3-6100
GPU: Radeon R9 380 4GB
Storage: SSD

As always, an important caveat is that MyDream is Early Access.

Despite this, and the fact that it is still in Alpha, the game is suprisingly stable and polished.

The graphics are cute, and the sound effects (while not mind-blowing) are appropriate.

The actual world-building aspesct of the game is intuitive, simple to use and there is a huge variety of items, objects, etc you can use.

Optimisation isn't perfect yet, and why would it be given its development status, but the game ran pretty well and I didn't encounter any bugs.

Multiplayer looks exciting (the one thing I haven't tried yet - I've been trying to work through the crafting / world-building mechanics in offline Single Player first).

I'm a big fan of the no-subscription model too - though to play online you need to sign for an account.

Overall, a thumbs up.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

MyDream

Controls: 70/100 Mouse+Keyboard

WASD to move, Shift to run, Space to jump, Double Space to go into Fly mode, Scroll Bar to Pick a Block To place with Clicking, Right Click to remove Blocks. Pretty much the rest is up to you to find out.

Audio: 65/100

A game without sound and music is bad, but Music is required on the game start up login
in, plus in-game Day Cycles. I think the only music I heard was where I created my first world before entering. It isn't so bad but improve on the making the game more welcoming with music and such.

Graphics: 70/100

I don't think the graphics of this game isn't so bad but if you could improve on it then great. The confusing part is the layout of the game that doesn't seem to be organized so I would like to really see a change in that to make it less confusing for those are new to the game.

Balance Between Challenging and Impossible: 45/100 (Don't count as points)

The game takes a bit of learning on how everything works pretty much so it's simple to build a house and play with your friends.

Other: 55/100

When you aren't using the shift button why does the character walk so slow? That needs a change to make the character walk a bit faster. xD you need to improve alot but so far I like it. Also find a way to make the game less ram demanding and fix up some multiplayer issues.

I recommend this game to those who like building stuff. Rated 260/400
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

MyDream lets you select an alien world type to create or join a player created world. Build your own or visit someone elses. Explore and create with friends in your own co-op world or adventure and complete quests in a prebuilt one.
The building system has the basic blocks of multiple colors, stairs and doors, Many types of textured blocks. Also has triangle blocks.
Walk, run or fly with your jetpack through vast landscapes. Interact with alien deer or little elemental golems.
The game has a terraform gun. It lets you model to more angles and shapes without having to build in a block grid.
Smooth gameplay.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDITED: 04/19.
Reminder: This is a early access review and it doesn't represent the final version. Although the game is in the early access phase, it is not lacking in content.

MyDream is a great sandbox game where you can play alone or with friends online. To play online you need to make an account but you don't need to make it to play offline. Online you can visit other people's world and it is amazing. I had a lot of fun playing with others. Also, be careful visiting worlds because there are traps that will try to kill you like Stone Dark.

The game starts like others building games, you create a random world where you can build things you like. There are walls, windows, doors, plants, stones, traps, signs and everything else a sandbox game has.

There are a few glitches here and there but that's normal for a Early Access game. I didn't had issues like freeze or crash during my gameplay.

Graphics, environments and building mechanics are great and overall, the game is pretty good and has a lot of potential.

If you like sandbox games and want to build structures, buildings and landscapes you should definitely buy this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Public Review on behalf of the Opium Pulses Steam group
Disclaimer: The copy of this game was provided by the developer for review purposes, yet it doesn't affect my review in any way.

Few words about the game
MyDream is a game based on an amazing idea of forming and exploring your world however you want to. You're able to create your own world or join any world created by other players and, well, build anything you want to. To be fair, there's still a long way to go before it will be finished and polished, but in the first 5 minutes of gameplay, you can clearly see the potential and how big this game might get in the near future.

Advantages
Gameplay is smooth and visibly optimized even for lower machines
Music is well made
Graphics are not really up to date, but they're still very good and enjoyable
Terraforming and building is really advanced and developed
Game is formed by the online community, some of online levels were literally amazing, can't wait to see it grow
Content of the game is very expanded, ton of things to build, create and even explore (price tag is 101% adequate)
Design of UI and menu overal is nice and clear
Disadvantages
Lacks any introduction to some mechanics and tools. There is a tutorial, but it's pretty unclear and chaotic
Online levels really take their time to load, in a few cases I had to wait over 5 minutes for it to load up
You will encounter some bugs for sure, but the game is still in the early access so give it a chance and be patient - it's worth it!
Summary
MyDream is slowly shaping into an amazing game, I can already see how it becomes an awesome AAA title, but there's still alot of work to do in my opinion. For now, you can do almost anything you want to with your own world, shape it and build there almost anything you want to. I had fun with exploring it and creating quests in my own world, but the most fun I had when I wandered in some online worlds - things people can create in there are amazing, players-driven" game is a great idea. I hope it will grow enough to meet dozens of players in there
date: it would be much more fun with others around
recommended: but unfortunately for now it's almost empty
hoursPlayed: I met only 1 player in one of the worlds. If you like any kind of games focused on building
voteText:
you will instantly fall in love with MyDream for sure.

Personal score
7.5 / 10
If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow Opium Pulses curator page right here for more reviewed games!"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A game similar to minecraft with the exception that it is 3D. There is also some elements of orcs must die in terms of its graphics and some of the gameplay.

Visual wise it is much better than most voxel games that i have played including minecraft. In terms of audio, there is room for improvement especially in the starting area but other areas or seeds seem to cover that relatively well. I experimented alot due to absence of tutorial which makes for some interesting and surprising things happening.

Having the ability to play with your friends online is a plus not to mention the amount of ideas the community could contribute in making their gameplay better for everyone.

Although an early access game, i can see this game being in the top 3 voxel games that utilizes unity engine. Overall am looking forward to its development and eventual full release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

IntroductionDeveloped and published by MyDream Interactive, Inc, MyDream is decribed as a fascinating open world, sandbox game that leads you into adventure and exploration. While exploring the world that you are in, you are able to build your own world with such a variety of tools and assets that are provided.

GameplayMyDream is a open world sandbox that was released on the 20th Febuary 2015. The game is based around generated levels and has a voxelized sort of world which you can create your own thing with anything that you can think of. Whether you wanna play online or offline is up to you, if your playing online you will need to create a account. There is a fair amount of assests and materials that are with the game, walls, windows, doors, plants, signs, stones and so many more. If I would have to describe this game, it would be a mix between Lego worlds and Minecraft because of the open world and creativity with what you can build throughout the game. Although I didn't spend that much time on the online part of the game, it does seem that you can visit other players worlds and see what they have created as well. With the game having pretty much endless possibilities to build and explore. The game is still in Early Access so you are going to expect some bugs here and there as you play through the game. I'm sure that they will be patched through the next few patches and updates. The game has a kind of unfinished tutorial, which doesn't really explain how each of the blocks work and how to use them.

The graphics of this game exceeds to be another minecarft clone. The graphics are way more than just blocked graphics and basic assests that you can use to create your worlds. There is a range of different types of graphics for each of the blocks, with all of them being nicely detailed. The players look alright, but I feel like the sprites could be crisped up and polished a bit more.

As far as the sound effects go for this game, they really aren't all that good. They seem to be a bit unclear and not really the high quality sound effects you would expect for a game like this. Although the games strong point isn't it's audio, I hope that they will sharpen up on the audio and make this game better in the upcoming updates and patches of this game.

Pros+ Many assests and blocks to use to create whatever you want
+ Online and Offline mode
+ Exceeds from just blocked graphics

Cons- Some bugs here and there
- Tutorial is unfinshed
- Player sprites could be a bit more polished up
- Sound effects could use some work

Result / Final thoughtsWith this game being in early access, it does seem to have a decent and nice amount of content and blocks that you can use. There is a wide variety of sort of blocks and materials that you can use to create anything that you can think of. It's not another mincraft clone, I would say that this gam exceeds to being so much more than a minecarft clone when it comes to building. Although the game does need to work on some things, the tutorials, sound effects and some various bugs I still currently recommened this game.

Rating: 6.4/10
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a HUGE potential.
I think that this a one of the few indie EA games that actually uses the EA stage not to steal people's money but rather improve itself and slowly expand to a full game.
Dispite the fact that the game's graphics look a bit simplistic (something normal for a Minecraft type of game where the generated worlds is huge) it requires at least a good CPU. I suggest you play this with a Quad core or you might not be able to enjoy this boundless world to the maximum.
As far as I know, the devs are working on a MyDreamVR Tower Defense mod which is currently in beta (they have experience with VR so I this sounds promising).
Another positive aspect of the game are the hundrets of items which you can use in order to create a world of your liking.
Your world can be visit by others and of course you have access to all other community-made worlds.
In a nutshell, I recommend investing into this game's future development

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hello!

Game - MyDream
Creator(s) - MyDream Interactive
Reviewer(s) - MiKapp1t

MyDream is an immersive game; from the splash screen, the log-in screen and to the loading screen, I felt excited. It's a game with an extremely high indie standard, and aims for nothing less. MyDream has many outstanding aspects, and understandably, as it is a new game, also has a couple minor flaws, but with the dedication of the developer(s), MyDream will undoubtedly address these small issues.

MyDream is an online first-person world creation simulator with an interesting concept which is what makes the game unique, as users create and build their own worlds and then publish them to the community so others can join and so forth. MyDream contains simple yet decent graphics, enthusiastic music and sound, basic controls and community based content. The main problem I encountered was a minimal to no Oceanic community and lag on Mac, however I believe other area of the world have decent servers and a lively community and if you're playing on PC, then you're in for a good time.

Plus:
+ Simple yet decent graphics
+ Enthusiastic music and sound
+ Interesting concept
+ Basic controls
+ Community content

Minus:
- Minimal to no Oceanic servers
- Lag on Mac

Verdict:
7 / 10


For more game reviews and giveaways, visit Official MiKapp1t's Mates!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

MyDream is a building and quest making game. It highly depends on the community, which can be good and can end up really badly.

About the gameplay: you can play offline if you want but its mostly an online game. You can build full worlds and make quest for others, or you can just join an already made world and do the created quest. It has everything a building game wants. you can create elements, from other elements, and so on. If you are creative its a really great game for you.

Pros     Great concept
Lots of possibilities
Community based
It doesn't have an end, you can always find more worlds if you want
Cons    Servers really need some updating  (sometimes it took a lot of time to connect, sometimes it doesnt even connect)
Sometimes I fell through the terrain
The walking speed is waaaaaaaay to slow  It has sprint option, but in my opinion the sprint speed should be the walking speed. Or faster than that.
Community based But hey its in early access!!!

TL,DR: ITs a great game, need some polishing, but really promising. Definitely worth to pick it up

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*DISCLAIMER; This copy of the game was provided by a group for the sole purpose of reviewing. This doesn't affect my opinion of the game in any way.*

(This Review was written about version 0.90, so some of the flaws mentioned may have been ironed out at a later date)

MyDream is definitely a game i can see having a lot of potential... if it stays afloat. It's an Open World Sandbox-Building game, not exactly dissimilar to Minecraft or it's many clones. In that regard, it does what it does well.

The building is fairly fluid, and fun. The interface can be a bit confusing to work with at first, but once you get adjusted to it, you can build some pretty impressive things. The Screenshots at the top of the page of those large, lavish structures? If you've got the time, it's not hard to do that sort of thing.

The controls are fairly intuitive. If you've ever played a similar game, then they'll make sense to you. If you've ever played Minecraft or anything similar, you'll adjust pretty quickly.

Graphically, it looks really nice. My only major complaint is that the blocks/voxels you use to build with don't exactly... match" the enviornments
date: but that's easy enough to overlook. The playermodels have the same issue
hoursPlayed: it's easy enough to overlook.\n\nMy only major problem is the multiplayer. At the moment
voteText: there's a decent amount of multiplayer going on
helpfulPercent: so it's easy enough to find a server. In a year or so? I don't know. The game
votesTotal: doesn't really hold up long by yourself; once you've built something fairly impressive
votesFunny: there isn't much else to do at this point. If the game holds up
commentsCount: perhaps this worry won't be founded. Here's hoping it does.\n\nOverall
column16: i quite like MyDream. It makes for a decent building experience
column17: and it's honestly fun. I'd recommend it if you've got the spare cash
column18: so long as you're creative and come into it knowing there isn't much else to it other than that."
